org.digijava.kernel.util

Class SiteUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.kernel.util.SiteUtils

  • public class SiteUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class containts site-related utillity functions. Site must be always identified by Site object

      • getModuleNamesForSite

        public static java.util.Set getModuleNamesForSite(Site site)
        Returns Set of module names, which can be used on the site. Does not include modules with only shared instances (for example, admin)
        Parameters:
        site - Site object
        Returns:
        Set of module names and empty set, if there are no modules

      • getModuleNamesForSite

        public static java.util.Set getModuleNamesForSite(Site site,
                                                  boolean includeShared)
        Returns Set of module names, which can be used on the site
        Parameters:
        site - Site object
        includeShared - boolean if true, includes modules with shared instances. For example, admin. If false - only modules, which have explicitly defined instances for the given site
        Returns:
        Set of module names and empty set, if there are no modules

      • getModuleInstances

        public static java.util.Set getModuleInstances(Site site,
                                               java.lang.String module)
        Returns Set of ModuleInstance objects, which are available for the given site and belong to specified module, including shared instances. The returned Set can be used to search ModuleInstance objects in it
        Parameters:
        site - Site object
        module - String name of the module
        Returns:
        Set of ModuleInstance objects and empty set, if there are no instances

      • getSiteURL

        public static java.lang.String getSiteURL(SiteDomain siteDomain,
                                          java.lang.String scheme,
                                          int port,
                                          java.lang.String contextPath)
        Assembles site's root URL for given SiteDomain object and other parameters
        Parameters:
        siteDomain - SiteDomain object
        scheme - request scheme. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        port - Server port. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        contextPath - WEB Application context path. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        site's root URL

      • getSiteURL

        public static java.lang.String getSiteURL(java.lang.String domain,
                                          java.lang.String path,
                                          java.lang.String scheme,
                                          int port,
                                          java.lang.String contextPath)
        Assembles site's root URL for given site's domain, path and other parameters
        Parameters:
        domain - Site's domain
        path - Site's path (if any)
        scheme - request scheme. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        port - Server port. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        contextPath - WEB Application context path. Can be determined from HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        site's root URL

      • getDefaultSiteDomain

        public static SiteDomain getDefaultSiteDomain(Site site)
        Returns default domain for the given site. If site does not have default domain (in case if someone changed it in the database), returns one of the domains. It will return null, if site does not have any domains
        Parameters:
        site - Site
        Returns:
        default domain for the given site

      • prefixDomainName

        public static java.lang.String prefixDomainName(java.lang.String dbDomainName)
        Converts the original (as defined in the database) domain name to a "prefixed" domain name. Prefixed domain is calculated as:
        siteDomain = prefix + siteDbDomain;
        where "prefix" is defined in digi.xml's <server-type> tag.

        Prefixes help independant installations on different physical servers (different IPs) to use the same database hence the same domain records, for sites. By putting prefix in digi.xml the domain names that system uses runtime will change, so you can assign prefixed domain names to a different server (say, development or staging), but use the same database records.

        Parameters:
        dbDomainName - name of the domain in database (non-prefixed domain)
        Returns:
        prefixed domain if prefix is set in digi configuration. dbDomainName parameter value - if it is not set

      • getNumericSiteId

        public static java.lang.Long getNumericSiteId(java.lang.String siteName)
                                       throws DgException
        Get numeric site id for site, identified by string id
        Parameters:
        siteId - string identifier of the site. "demosite", "dglogin", etc
        Returns:
        Long site identity
        Throws:
        DgException - if error occurs

      • isSendAlertsToAdmin

        public static boolean isSendAlertsToAdmin(Site site)
        Returns true, if module-specific alerts must be sent to site admins too. false - if only module admins receive such alerts. If site does not have this parameter defined, it is determined by hierarchy tree
        Parameters:
        site - Target site
        Returns:
        boolean value

      • getSiteIdentity

        public static java.lang.String getSiteIdentity(Site site,
                                               java.lang.String service)
        Returns site identity based on configuration setting. If siteIdentityService service is defined in the system, it is asked to calculate identity. If it is not - site's string identity is returned
        Parameters:
        site - Site
        service - String name of the service for which identity should be determined. For example - "google", "omniture",
        Returns:
        site identity

        boolean value
